course_title: Environmental Health Seminar: Impact Eval.Global & Env.Hlth
class_notes:
Topic:  Impact Evaluation of Global and Environmental Health Programs and Projects 
Provides students with the conceptual and analytical skills to design, analyze, and communicate data from impact evaluations of environmental and global public health programs or projects. Develops student understand of the role of impact evaluation in policy analysis, planning, program design and management. This course is designed to be a complement to GH521, Monitoring & Evaluation of Global Health Projects, which is a suggested, though not required pre-requisite. It is an elective course to be taken by 2nd year MPH students and PhD students.
course_description: Various topics by GDEH faculty. Check OPUS/Atlas for current topics and descriptions.
schedule_location: M 3pm-4:50pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R102
